subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... It s not very hard:  TestNG supports both 1.4 and 1.5 annotations by using QDox to parse 1.4 annotations: /** * @testng.test groups = functional db */
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Kent Beck

> I can't think of a simple way to make JUnit 4 work with Java
> 1.4, though.

It's not very hard: TestNG supports both 1.4 and 1.5 annotations by using
QDox to parse 1.4 annotations:

/**
* @... groups = "functional db"
*/
public void insertIntoDataBase() { ... }

equivalent to

@Test(groups = { "functional", "db" })
public void insertIntoDataBase() { ... }

It takes some effort to structure the code so the parsing is entirely based
on interfaces, but it's well worth it (and an interesting challenge). But
it's totally transparent for the user (they just need to use a different jar
file depending on whether they want 1.4 or 1.5 annotations).
